discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I would go with C 'Theme' Not 'Template'
While creating a custom template could help ensure consistency in the layout and structure of Experience Cloud sites, it may not fully address the branding aspect. Templates primarily focus on defining the structure and layout of a site, including page layouts, components, and navigation. 

On the other hand, a custom theme allows for the consistent application of branding elements such as colors, fonts, logos, and styles across multiple sites. It provides a centralized way to manage branding aspects, ensuring uniformity in the visual presentation and user experience across all Experience Cloud sites. This approach simplifies the process of applying the new style guide and facilitates easy updates or modifications to maintain brand consistency over time.

comments.content: Therefore, while creating a custom template could be part of the solution, using a custom theme would be more directly aligned with the goal of unifying branding across all Experience Cloud sites.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers is looking to build a new self-service site. Users will post questions, read Knowledge articles, and view case reports. Users will not be registering deals or participating in any other sales activity.

Which external user license meets these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The external user license that best meets the requirements described for Universal Containers' new self-service site is:

D. Customer Community Plus

This license type provides users with access to standard Salesforce objects, such as Cases for viewing case reports, and allows them to interact with Knowledge articles and post questions in a community setting. It is designed for customers who need access to a wide range of CRM data and features for self-service support and collaboration. 

Option A (Authenticated Service Site User) is not a valid Salesforce license type.
Option B (External Community Plus) is typically used for more extensive collaboration and business processes involving partners, customers, and employees.
Option C (External Identity) provides limited access to Salesforce features and is not suitable for users who need to interact with standard objects like Cases.

D is the correct option. Customer community plus license gives access to reports and dashboards. They want users to also view Case "Reports".
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.users_license_types_communities.htm&type=5

discussion.content:

A. Chat: Enables real-time communication between partners and support teams, facilitating quick issue resolution and enhancing partner engagement.
